page.title: 12The Strawberry Industry
page.content: Strawberry growing has been most important in this area since{1860}. The strawberry grows well on the {light stony soil}which warms up quickly in Spring and gives an{early {market}sale to London and other markets. Prayers used to be said so that the weather would be good.Schools used to take their holidays from mid-June to mid-July to coincide with the{picking {period. } By importing{gypsies and travellers the problem of labour was solved.Many of the travellers actually stopped moving around and settled locally.The special{fruit trains}left at 10 a.m. The so called "{Strawberry Line}" was opened in 1888.A{basket factory}was built nearby in 1913. Now many of the strawberry fields have houses built on them.
